name: Image Crosspost
author: Fabrizio Pivari

sections.description:
Image Crosspost plugin will crosspost (via email) every local image in a published post to the selected web services.

In detail: every time you publish a post, Image Crosspost extracts every local image (<img src=”http://www.local-site o absolute path) and using the alt and title description (or title of the post) will send an email to the supported web application with the images in the attach. From version 2.x the web applications supported are Flickr, Twitpic, Twitgoo, Twitrpix and img.ly. Post tags will become Flickr tags. You can set Flickr privacy uploading by email: Visible to friends, Visible to family, Visible to friends and family, Only visible to you, Visible to everyone.
sections.installation:
1. Upload image-crosspost directory to the /wp-content/plugins/ directory
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress
  3. Customize the plugin in the settings page (Admin > Settings > Image Crosspost)
sections.faq:
Where can I find more information about uploading by email to Flickr?

These are the pages of Flickr where you can find more information (few need you log in):

Your account / Uploading by email – Here you can set the email to upload your photos or video and the tags to add each time

Your account / Upload by email / To your blog – Here you can set up a special email address to automatically post photos or video to your blog.

Where can I find more information about uploading by email to Twitpic?

These is the page of Twitpic where you can find more information (it needs you log in):

Mobile Settings – About Posting via Email When posting via email, be sure to put your photo caption in the subject line of the email, not the body.

Where can I find more information about uploading by email to Twitgoo?

These is the page of Twitgoo where you can find more information (it needs you log in):

Mobile Settings – Uploading pictures to Twitter has never been quicker! Add this email address to your address book as Twitgoo and then email or picture message your photos with your status in the subject line of the email and your picture attached!

Where can I find more information about uploading by email to Twitrpix?

These is the page of Twitrpix where you can find more information (it needs you log in):

Mobile Settings Did You Know? You can upload and share photos from your mobile phone. The subject becomes your tweet (status update) on Twitter.

Where can I find more information about uploading by email to img.ly?

These is the page of img.ly where you can find more information (it needs you log in):
